Description: Papyrus fragment: the left-hand side of the first 8 lines of this Coptic text are preserved, written against the fibres. The other side of the papyrus is blank. EA 75325, 75324, 75323, 75322, 75321 are mounted together.
Curator's comments: Provenance: The acquisition details for this text suggest that its place of origin may have been the Hermopolite monastery of Apa Apollo.
Bibliographic references: Clackson 2000 / Coptic and Greek Texts relating to the Hermopolite Monastery of Apa Apollo (p.12, 64, pl.7)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (86571) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/86571)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Monastery of Apa Apollo
